page.title: 10The Landscape of the area
page.content: Much of the land is flat and low lying on the flood plain of the River Trent. Over the years much effort has gone into confining the River Trent to its own course but there are still occasional floods and it is because of these periodic inundations over hundreds of years that the area is so richly fertile and therefore largely given over to arable use. Water is an important feature with the Rivers Trent and Idle,the Chesterfield Canal and large drains(dykes) many of which were built by Vermuyden in the early 17th Century when large areas were drained. {River Trent:}This part is tidal and navigable;a feature is the Eagre which is a tidal wave created in certain circumstances when the tide and the current meet(similar to the Severn Bore).
